scales 0.5.0.9000

Add arbitrary expression to a label. The symbol that will be replace by the label value is .x.

Source: R/formatter.r
math_format.Rd

Add arbitrary expression to a label. The symbol that will be replace by the label value is .x.

math_format(expr = 10^.x, format = force)

Arguments

expr

expression to use
format

another format function to apply prior to mathematical transformation - this makes it easier to use floating point numbers in mathematical expressions.

Value

a function with single parameter x, a numeric vector, that returns a list of expressions

See also

plotmath()

Examples

math_format()(1:10)
#> [[1]]
#> 10^`1`
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> 10^`2`
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> 10^`3`
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> 10^`4`
#> 
#> [[5]]
#> 10^`5`
#> 
#> [[6]]
#> 10^`6`
#> 
#> [[7]]
#> 10^`7`
#> 
#> [[8]]
#> 10^`8`
#> 
#> [[9]]
#> 10^`9`
#> 
#> [[10]]
#> 10^`10`
#> 
math_format(alpha + frac(1, .x))(1:10)
#> [[1]]
#> alpha + frac(1, `1`)
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> alpha + frac(1, `2`)
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> alpha + frac(1, `3`)
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> alpha + frac(1, `4`)
#> 
#> [[5]]
#> alpha + frac(1, `5`)
#> 
#> [[6]]
#> alpha + frac(1, `6`)
#> 
#> [[7]]
#> alpha + frac(1, `7`)
#> 
#> [[8]]
#> alpha + frac(1, `8`)
#> 
#> [[9]]
#> alpha + frac(1, `9`)
#> 
#> [[10]]
#> alpha + frac(1, `10`)
#> 
math_format()(runif(10))
#> [[1]]
#> 10^`0.8882496`
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> 10^`0.9963469`
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> 10^`0.5001915`
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> 10^`0.358967`
#> 
#> [[5]]
#> 10^`0.774913`
#> 
#> [[6]]
#> 10^`0.5844753`
#> 
#> [[7]]
#> 10^`0.6339764`
#> 
#> [[8]]
#> 10^`0.8586662`
#> 
#> [[9]]
#> 10^`0.5668943`
#> 
#> [[10]]
#> 10^`0.252997`
#> 
math_format(format = percent)(runif(10))
#> [[1]]
#> 10^`91.9%`
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> 10^`86.7%`
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> 10^`24.9%`
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> 10^`40.3%`
#> 
#> [[5]]
#> 10^`77.0%`
#> 
#> [[6]]
#> 10^`11.9%`
#> 
#> [[7]]
#> 10^`19.5%`
#> 
#> [[8]]
#> 10^`16.5%`
#> 
#> [[9]]
#> 10^`66.3%`
#> 
#> [[10]]
#> 10^`85.7%`
#>
